Whoso loveth instruction loveth knowledge: but he that hateth reproof <FI>is<Fi> brutish.<CM>
A good <FI>man<Fi> obtaineth favour of the LORD: but a man of wicked devices will he condemn.<CM>
A man shall not be established by wickedness: but the root of the righteous shall not be moved.<CM>
A virtuous woman <FI>is<Fi> a crown to her husband: but she that maketh ashamed <FI>is<Fi> as rottenness in his bones.<CM>
The thoughts of the righteous <FI>are<Fi> right: <FI>but<Fi> the counsels of the wicked <FI>are<Fi> deceit.<CM>
The words of the wicked <FI>are<Fi> to lie in wait for blood: but the mouth of the upright shall deliver them.<CM>
The wicked are overthrown, and <FI>are<Fi> not: but the house of the righteous shall stand.<CM>
A man shall be commended according to his wisdom: but he that is of a perverse heart shall be despised.<RF>of a…: Heb. perverse of heart<Rf><CM>
<FI>He that is<Fi> despised, and hath a servant, <FI>is<Fi> better than he that honoureth himself, and lacketh bread.<CM>
A righteous <FI>man<Fi> regardeth the life of his beast: but the tender mercies of the wicked <FI>are<Fi> cruel.<RF>tender…: or, bowels<Rf><CM>
He that tilleth his land shall be satisfied with bread: but he that followeth vain <FI>persons is<Fi> void of understanding.<CM>
The wicked desireth the net of evil <FI>men<Fi>: but the root of the righteous yieldeth <FI>fruit<Fi>.<RF>the net: or, the fortress<Rf><CM>
The wicked is snared by the transgression of <FI>his<Fi> lips: but the just shall come out of trouble.<RF>The wicked…: Heb. The snare of the wicked is in the transgression of lips<Rf><CM>
A man shall be satisfied with good by the fruit of <FI>his<Fi> mouth: and the recompence of a man's hands shall be rendered unto him.<CM>
The way of a fool <FI>is<Fi> right in his own eyes: but he that hearkeneth unto counsel <FI>is<Fi> wise.<CM>
A fool's wrath is presently known: but a prudent <FI>man<Fi> covereth shame.<RF>presently: Heb. in that day<Rf><CM>
<FI>He that<Fi> speaketh truth sheweth forth righteousness: but a false witness deceit.<CM>
There is that speaketh like the piercings of a sword: but the tongue of the wise <FI>is<Fi> health.<CM>
The lip of truth shall be established for ever: but a lying tongue <FI>is<Fi> but for a moment.<CM>
Deceit <FI>is<Fi> in the heart of them that imagine evil: but to the counsellors of peace <FI>is<Fi> joy.<CM>
There shall no evil happen to the just: but the wicked shall be filled with mischief.<CM>
Lying lips <FI>are<Fi> abomination to the LORD: but they that deal truly <FI>are<Fi> his delight.<CM>
A prudent man concealeth knowledge: but the heart of fools proclaimeth foolishness.<CM>
The hand of the diligent shall bear rule: but the slothful shall be under tribute.<RF>slothful: or, deceitful<Rf><CM>
Heaviness in the heart of man maketh it stoop: but a good word maketh it glad.<CM>
The righteous <FI>is<Fi> more excellent than his neighbour: but the way of the wicked seduceth them.<RF>excellent: or, abundant<Rf><CM>
The slothful <FI>man<Fi> roasteth not that which he took in hunting: but the substance of a diligent man <FI>is<Fi> precious.<CM>
In the way of righteousness <FI>is<Fi> life; and <FI>in<Fi> the pathway <FI>thereof there is<Fi> no death.<CM>
